item.title: Shoot for the Moon or Take It Slow? Tech Giants Talk Blockchain - CoinDesk
item.description:
Shoot for the Moon or Take It Slow? Tech Giants Talk Blockchain - CoinDesk

Three massive tech companies and one of the most heavily funded startups in blockchain today debated the merits of deploying blockchain technology incrementally or going after moonshots with the power to shift entire industry paradigms. Speaking on stage at this year's Consensus 2016 conference in New York City, executives representing more than $571bn of market capitalization and $76m in venture capital engaged in a linguistic dual over which path was best, with the occasional point of agreement.

item.title: The Bitcoin affair: Craig Wright 'to move' Satoshi coin - BBC News
item.description:
The Bitcoin affair: Craig Wright 'to move' Satoshi coin - BBC News

The man who has identified himself as the creator of Bitcoin plans to provide further proof to his claim. Craig Wright's spokesman told the BBC that he would "move a coin from an early block" belonging to the crypto-currency's inventor "in the coming days".

item.title: Who created bitcoin? Craig Wright, Satoshi Nakamoto mystery still not solved
item.description:
Who created bitcoin? Craig Wright, Satoshi Nakamoto mystery still not solved

SAN FRANCISCO -- Who is Satoshi Nakamoto? For many in the tech world, the identity of bitcoin's elusive creator has been a long-running parlor game. And the speculation might not be over. Australian entrepreneur Craig Steven Wright, who announced Monday that he founded the digital currency , convinced at least one longtime bitcoin contributor that he's the real deal.

item.title: The Bitcoin Ecosystem's Communications Deficits
item.description:
The Bitcoin Ecosystem's Communications Deficits

This is a guest post by Jim Harper and the opinions reflected are those of the author. If triumphalism drove adoption, Bitcoin use would already be widespread, and its price against other currencies would be stratospheric. But the existence of a genius protocol does not guarantee its success.

item.title: Ernst & Young Joins Post-Trade Distributed Ledger Group
item.description:
Ernst & Young Joins Post-Trade Distributed Ledger Group

The Post-Trade Distributed Ledger (PTDL) Group announced today that 37 financial institutions are now members of the consortium. The PTLD Group was formed last year by big post-trade industry leaders to examine the impact of distributed ledgers on the securities clearing industry.

item.title: Antonopoulos Declined 'Opportunity' to ID Satoshi, Doesn't Care
item.description:
Antonopoulos Declined 'Opportunity' to ID Satoshi, Doesn't Care

Identifying Satoshi Nakamoto is a distraction from the fact that nobody controls bitcoin, says regular commentator and evangelist Andreas Antonopoulos. Also read: Andresen Denies Hacking as GitHub Access Limited Formerly Chief Security Officer at Blockchain and regular speaker at major bitcoin events, Andreas Antonopoulos has testified before Senate committees in two countries, authored the O'Reilly book Mastering Bitcoin and appears regularly on the popular Let's Talk Bitcoin podcast.

item.title: Coinsource Brings Seven New Bitcoin ATMs to Los Angeles
item.description:
Coinsource Brings Seven New Bitcoin ATMs to Los Angeles

Coinsource owns one of the biggest Bitcoin ATM networks in the world, and they recently launched another seven devices in the Los Angeles area. Additionally, two new Bitcoin ATMs have made their way to Las Vegas as well. All in all, a good move for Coinsource, who now own 30 devices in the United States.

item.title: Technology and Choice #05, Scam Tech 101
item.description:
Technology and Choice #05, Scam Tech 101

In this Episode Finally, Robert and John get to really start exploring scams. What is a scam? Why is it so important to understand the mechanics that make something a scam, or not? What does this all have to do with technology and choice?

item.title: Generated a transaction id but not seen on blockchain
item.description:
Generated a transaction id but not seen on blockchain

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top Transaction id: a667e6d1a80c17bd0b55afec7c6ec618ca64a2a6c1b4f9badaf1c883bf5cb5dd I sent bitcoin from electrum wallet with a 0.002 miner fee but it is showing unconfirmed.

item.title: iPayYou Launches the World's Easiest, Safest and Most Useful Bitcoin Wallet
item.description:
iPayYou Launches the World's Easiest, Safest and Most Useful Bitcoin Wallet

With its ease of use and historically low costs, the new iPayYou wallet is set to redefine bitcoin as a payment method for everyday consumers May 3, 2016 - New York, NY - iPayYou, a Seattle-based company aiming to make Bitcoin simple, yesterday launched the World's Easiest, Safest and Most Useful Bitcoin Wallet for consumers.
